intro: Pandaca callosa, commonly known as the roughleaf pandaca, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
